values:
Last Monday I went to Notre Dame law school to visit the school and attend a seminar.  The campus is beautiful and I think it has moved to number one on my perspective school list.  The international law center in London is also a big plus.  I put some pictures of it up on facebook so check it out.  Now on to things that are bothering me:

1.) ESPN.com, I check this website several times a day and lately the writiing in the articles has bothered me with some of the sentences they use.  This sentence is an example "Anna Benson, an actress and model who has posed topless, filed for divorce in Atlanta on March 31."  What does the fact that Anna Benson has posed topless have to do with the fact that she is filing for divorce?  These next two sentences from a different article also bothered me. "Hours after an exotic dancer was allegedly raped by members of the Duke University lacrosse team, a player apparently sent an e-mail saying he wanted to invite more strippers to his dorm room, kill them and skin them. It was not clear whether the message was serious or a joke."  The last sentence is the one that bothers me.  I'm going to go out on a limb and guess that he was joking, but lets pretend that he was serious would you really send out an e-mail letting all your teammates know that your were planning to do it.

2.) The next thing that is bothering me is the kid that sits behind me in my global Ilasmic politcs class.  On Monday he came to to class dress in black sweatpants and a black sweatshirt, that's fine alot of of people go to class dressed like that.  But what bothered me was his choice of footwear, he wore black dress shoes.  No matter how hard you try wearing dress shoes with sweatpants does not make it classier.  Today this same kind continued to make references to the Ninja Turtles during the class discussion, keep in mind this is a class about global Islmaic politics I don't see much of a corealation. 

3.) Next is Tom Delay, what you did was wrong please go away.  Stop trying to blame the fact you took money from Jack Abrahmoff on liberals.  Stop going to talk shows talking about how you have friends in the Christian right and you might go work for them.  Just go back to Texas and drink mimosas with Ross Perot.

4.) Cynthia McKinney the reason the capitol hill police officer grabbed you was because you did not stop at the security check point not because you are "a female black congresswoman."  There are real issues of racism this is not one of them.  Just admit you were wrong and face your punishment, don't make it into a race issue because it is not one.

That is all that bothers me for now.   Now in honor of Tom Delay I  leave you with one of my favorite quotes from him,  good thing he still clings to sterotypes from the 1950s, "A woman can take care of the family. It takes a man to provide structure, to provide stability."

I found this online and thought I would repost this:
Top 10 courses at WMU:

10. Philosophy: Why Don't They Spell It with an "F"?

9. Pre-law Seminar: Age of Consent in 50 States

8. Sandwich Making: A Project Course

7. Hand-Shadow Workshop

6. Subtraction: Additions Tricky Friend

5. Cliffs Notes vs. Monarch Notes: 2 Views of the Classics

4. Hydraulic Principles of the Keg

3. The College Classroom: A Simulation

2. The ABCs: An Extended Version

1. Outside the lines: tricky coloring books

"The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance."--Aristotle

I'm not very happy with the seedings for the NCAA tournament and the teams that were left out. Allan Ray a player for Villanova had is eye poked in a game last week and he is expected to play in the tournament. I found a video of it and it is definately worth looking at, but it is a little nasty.
One more reason why my school is better than yours: "Adult film star Ron Jeremy will debate recovering porn addict Michael Leahy at 8 p.m. March 14 in Plachta Auditorium."

If you needed another reason why Canada is better than the United States here it is; potato chips.  Frito Lays has flavors not available in the United States: Fries n' Gravy, Roast Chicken, Salsa, Smokey Bacon and Ketchup.
This has been a very productive weekend for me I downloaded all the Beatles and Marilyn Manson albums I am also downloading Janis Joplin albums.  I have been sleeping most of the weekend because i think I have ebola or some other nasty virus.  I had some Jager so I should feel better tomorrow.
"I used to go missing a lot... Miss Canada, Miss United Kingdom, Miss World."--George Best

So last night we got like eight feet of snow, and nobody bothered to plow until noon.
The electricity bill last month was around $140, how can they charge so much for something I can make with a ballon and my hair. I had an interview for the summer orientation mentor job yesterday, it went pretty good and I'll find next week if I got the job.  
"The average American's day planner has fewer holes in it than Ray Charles's dart board."
Dennis Miller

My new classes are going to be fun, my favorite will be PSC 398B Islam and Politics.  In my business law class I learned two very interesting facts the first being that the legal age of consent for marriage in Kentucky and Tennesse is 12 and the second being that in Kentucky you can marry your first cousin.  I also read in one of the local papers that a couple in Shepard that had ben posing as a married couple were in fact brother and sister.  To top it off they had three children.  I went to b-dubs tonight with Brett, Carol, Dan Calvin and several other people the food was good and we "borrowed" a bottle of ketchup.
I went to the U Cup the other night and had an interesting conversation with a Mt. Pleasant native.  I was reading one of my political science books and this guy comes over and sits at the table next to me.  The guy looked like he belonged in Deliverence.  We started talking about politics and got on the topic of gun control.  His position on gun control was citizens should be able to possess any weapon the government has. In order to clarify his position I asked if this included chemical, biological and nuclear weapons, he said yes and believed that people should trust him more than the trust the government.  People like this scare me.
"Russians will consume marinated mushrooms and vodka, salted herring and vodka, smoked salmon and vodka, salami and vodka, caviar on brown bread and vodka, pickled cucumbers and vodka, cold tongue and vodka, red beet salad and vodka, scallions and vodka-anything and everything and vodka."--Hedrick Smith

I came back to Mount Pleasant on thursday,I was able to buy my books without waiting in line and they were about $200 cheaper this semester.  I also just found out that Miexner is in Hawaii for a conference so the first week of class is canceled, any professor that drinks a beer in class is a good one.  I am watching a cool documentary on LOGO about gay and lesbian Orthodox Jews, it is pretty interesting.  The auto show starts next weekend which means I'm heading home to check it out.  i have also been busy reading several books, one of which I'll write about in my next post.
"Americans have been taught that their nation is civilized and humane. But, too often, U.S. actions have been uncivilized and inhumane."--Howard Zinn

Break has been pretty good.  I saw Syriana and Munich both are good movies but I was a little dissapointed with Munich.  It's not quite historically accurate and it is fairly long.  I love Christmas eve, every year we celbrate with my Dad's side of the family and enjoy some great German food.  82 days until the next good holiday St. Patrick's day.
"There's nothing sadder in this world than to awake Christmas morning and not be a child."--Erma Bombeck

I'm hoping to be on the road by 12 today, I was planning on leaving yesterday but it worked out for the better that I stuck around.  Staying around gave me a chance to get some stuff done and have lunch with my favorite professor, Sterling Johnson.  I also have to turn in my application for academic orientation mentor.  I have to sell back the rest of my books today and whatever they don't buy I'll sell over the internet.  This semester went by very fast which is kind of sad because some of my closest friends up here are graduating in May and a couple graduate next week.  I'm kind of excited to see the new King Kong movie, the 1933 version is one of my favorite movies and this one looks like they tried to stay pretty true to it.  If anybody hates Larry the Cable Guy as much as I do read this letter by David Cross.  David Cross is a comedian/actor who acted in Arrested Development and a few other things. 

" These ballot initiatives remind us that America is the land where people are free to dream whatever they want, so long as that dream doesn't make Midwesterners feel icky!"-- Lewis Black

I had my first exam of the week today at 10 for HST221 and I think it went pretty good, I wrote kind alot on the essay portion of the exam.  My PSC150 exam was great I finished it in 15 minutes and I am officaly a political science god.  Prior to today I was hating the world and very one in it.  Now I've re-evaluated and hate only most people.

I know some of you haven't purchased me a Christmas gift yet and since I am a deadhead here are some ideas.  Speaking of Christmas Jerry Falwell started an e-mail campaign to retailers accusing them of "taking the Christ out of Christmas."  Good luck with that, Christ was taking out of Christmas the day Santa Claus was invented. 

In my procrastination of studying I was reading Der Spiegel and came across a couple of very interesting news stories.  The first one recieved very little coverage in the United States, it is about a German citizen that was kidnapped by the CIA and held for months in Afghanistan.  The second story is about the role the CIA is playing in the role on terror and if your looking for reasons why the United States seems to be making more enemies than friends these days this is a good start.

" I'd like to die like my father died... My father died fucking. My father was 57 when he died. The woman was 18. My father came and went at the same time. "--Richard Pryor

Just finished  watching the world cup draw and it doesn't look good for the united states, their group has 3 of the top 12 nations in the world.  Anyway here are the groupings:
Group A              Group B              Group C                  Group D            Group E
1. Germany           England              Argentina                Mexico             Italy
2. Costa Rica        Paraguay             Ivory Coast              Iran               Ghana
3. Poland           Trinidad&Tobago       Serbia&Montenegro        Angola             USA 
4. Ecuador           Sweden               Netherlands              Portugal           Czech Republic

Group F             Group G                Group H
1. Brazil           France                 Spain
2. Croatia          Switzerland            Ukraine
3. Australia        Korea Republic         Tunisia
4. Japan            Togo                   Saudi Arabia


I was watching the O' Reilly Factor to watch part of the Howard Stern inteview but later in the show he compared the left wing in american politics to nazis.  A better analogy could be used.  Exam week is going to be super easy, my speech class has no exam, African political systems has a take home essay, World politics is half take home essay and half in class exam with question pulled directly off the previous two exams, my history exam should be easy and my intro to politcal science class is always easy.
"I do believe the Democratic party has moved far to the right. I do believe that the party has a bunch of elephants running around in donkey clothes."--Al Sharpton

It ia about 4am and I still haven't gone to bed and I think I'll regret that tomorrow, luckly I have only one class tomorrow.  I have five more classes before exam week and I'm looking forward to Holiday break and decorating the holiday tree.  New Years eve I'm thinking about heading over to Canada; windsor or sarnia are the most likely options.  Toranto is about as for as I'd go for a night but Kitcher or Guelph are pretty cool cities too.  If anybody is interested let me know, we could figure something out. Nip/Tuck today was great to bad there are only two more episodes this season.  It was pretty cool that they quote Erik Erikson in today's episode.  Right now I'm sitting in the living room watching Emmanuelle in Space on HBO with Brett.  I'm not quite sure how to describe this movie all I can say is rent it if you want to see it.
"Islam teaches tolerance, not hatred; universal brotherhood, not enmity; peace, and not violence."--Pervez Musharraf

This weekend is going to suck, I have alot to do and a very short time to do it in.  That was alot of two letter words in a row.  Tomorrow I'm going down to Lansing with some people from Phi Alpha Delta to take a tour of Cooley Law School.  I really have no interest in attending Cooley but I already comitted to going but  there might be a visit to Olive Garden involved.  Saturday morning I have to be a pannelist for the admissions office and maybe give a tour after, my parents might be coming up to drop off my phone and I probably end up going out to eat with them too.  I also have to finish my case study of Rwanda, I've already typed about five pages and I still need to cover six more areas of the case study.
"A German is someone who cannot tell a lie without believing it himself."--Theodor Adorno

I'm packing up some stuff and getting ready to leave around 3:15,  I decided to skip my last class of the day because we never do much in it anyway.  I am watching the Wigan and Arsenal soccer game and the game just broke out into a fight with some players throwing punches.   Other than the fight the soccer game has been a pretty high scoring one, right now it is 3-2.  Sam the world's ugliest dog died today, he was almost 15. Here is a picture of Sam

" Thanksgiving is nothing but a toast to genocide."--Stephen Evans

Its was cold today and snow was on the ground, not cool.  I like snow but not in November two weeks ago I wore shorts and to the douche bag in my PSC 100 class than continues to wear sandals: everybody thinks you are an idiot, you don't look cool or like a badass because you are still wearing sandal.  I f you cannot afford shoes please tell me I will buy you a pair. Half of my classes were canceled today, I got an A on my History 221 class which was alot better than I thought I would get.  I did some more work on my case study paper and will most likely spend all day in the Library tomorrow.  I went to the K Mart up here and it looks like a soviet department store, they had nothing.  I didn't do any work on the website but I spent a few hours drawing.  Saturday is hockey night and I might make gumbo.
"Anyone who doesn't regret the passing of the Soviet Union has no heart. Anyone who wants it restored has no brains."--Vladimir Putin

I woke up around 11 and went to my African Politcal Sytems class at 2, we got out of class early so I went to the library to work on my case study paper.  After two hours of reading through testimony from Department of Defense officals about the genocide in Rwanda I was ready to tear my eyes out.  I came home ate some beef stew and did some more work on the website I hope to launch shortly.  I went to the wrestling meet at 7:30 and ate free pizza and pop, the meet was pretty good considering in was an intersquad meet so they were just wrestling other teammates.  Now I am watching Charlie Rose and he is interviewing the Dalai Lama, I love listening to the Dalai Lama the man is brilliant and I hope one day he can return to Tibet.  The school year is almost half way done and it has gone by fast.
"Whether one believes in a religion or not, and whether one believes in rebirth or not, there isn't anyone who doesn't appreciate kindness and compassion."--Dalai Lama

My sleep cycle is really screwed up right now, in the past two weeks the earliest I've gone to bed is around 3:30.  The weather up here was very English today.  We had the voting on inductions for Phi Alpha Delta today, two people didn't get in because they didn't do their stuff but we voted to let in the raunchy chick from the barrio.  The CFL playoffs are in full swing, my prediction for the Grey Cup is the Toronto Argonauts will beat the BC Lions.  If you have not seen any Canadian Football League it is basically the bastard child of the NFL. 
"Never get married in college; it's hard to get a start if a prospective employer finds you've already made one mistake."--Elbert Hubbard

Tomorrow Bill Nye is coming to speak at Finch Fieldhouse, my sources on Program Board tell me he is speaking about a science related topic.
   Today a Nor'easter blew through Mount Pleasant, luckily my house did not land on a witch nor was I transplantd to Oz.
   I went to the volleyball game on Friday it was a pretty good game and on my offical rankings of spectator sports volleyball is now ahead of bocce ball and buzkashi but still below curling.
   For those who have not seen me in awhile I am growing a beard.  At the moment my facial follicles are being patterned after Abraham Lincoln's beard, but if I get bored with it I think I'll go for the Karl Marx look.
   I've been watching alot of basketball in the last couple of weeks and I noticed how much Stan Van Gundy looks like Ron Jeremy.
"Think of how many religions attempt to validate themselves with prophecy. Think of how many people rely on these prophecies, however vague, however unfulfilled, to support or prop up their beliefs. Yet has there ever been a religion with the prophetic accuracy and reliability of science?"-- Carl Sagan

A couple of weeks ago I was watching Tavis Smiley and he had Miri Ben-Ari on as a guest, later in the show she preformed and her music is amazing.  Miri Ben-Ari is Israeli and a classically trained violinist; she has released a couple of jazz albums but this new album is something completely different.  The new album is called The Hip-Hop Violonist, she plays the violin with a hip hop beat and different singing or rapping over it.  I am not a fan of rap but this has such a unique sound that it is worth a listen.

Kwame Kilpatrick was re-elected yesterday, this makes no sense to me.  I see no reason why anybody would vote for him.  I also think there was some voter fraud going on, watching the results yesterday Hendrix had a 12% lead with 60% of the precincts reporting and he ends up losing by by 6%.  Something in there isn't quite kosher.

I have a new favorite TV show; Mad Money w/ Jim Cramer.  It airs on CNBC three times a day all week and it is very entertaining and informative.  For instance today I learned that the porn industry makes 52 billion dollars a year world wide and 12 billion a year in the US.  The 12 billion the porn industry made is more than NBC, ABC and CBS made combined.  

"I know of no country in which there is so little independence of mind and real freedom of discussion as in America."--Alexis de Tocqueville

Thursday I'm leaving to come home because Sage is coming home for a
couple of weeks, if anybody else is planning on bveing home lat me know
and we can do something. It will be nice to go home and relax this
weekend because the last couple of weekends have been crazy, I need a
break from partying. The Red Wings are kicking ass this year, hopefully
they keep it up. My phone is irritating for the past week I've only had
one bar of service.
"Without question, the greatest invention in the history of mankind is
beer. Oh, I grant you that the wheel was also a fine invention, but the
wheel does not go nearly as well with pizza."--Dave Barry

Sheryl Swoopes came out as being gay in a recent ESPN magizine article.  Sheryl Swoopes is one the stars in the WNBA and is the first big star in any sport to come as being gay.  Hopefully everything works out for her.
  Friday is the halloween party at the pub and I still don't have a costume.
  Monday night was the first of many "bad movie nights."  As the name suggests I get together with a bunch of people and watch bad movies on monday we watched "The Toxic Avenger" and the christmas classic "Santa Clause Conquers the Martians."  It was a fun time and next time we will probably watch some of Ed Wood's masterpieces.
  I like the people protesting the billboard for the new 50 Cent movie.  The reason they are protesting is because the billboard promotes violence.  I think it is pretty obivious that he promotes violence that is his image as a rapper.  Maybe next time they will protest McDonalds for promoting greasy food.
  The White Sox just won the World Series, I like seeing teams win it that haven't won in a long time.
"Baseball, it is said, is only a game. True. And the Grand Canyon is only a hole in Arizona. Not all holes, or games, are created equal."--George Will

I think it is colder inside the house than outside and I'm freezing.
  In my african political systems class today I was reading a friend's paper about the political structure in Nigeria and he used the phrase "very unique."  This bothers me, something cannot be very unique.  The word unique means that something is one of a kind.  So stop using very unique in your writing.
  "The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet."--Aristotle

Congress has been busy passing two different bills that are a complete waste of time.  The first one is the "the cheeseburger bill," the idea behind this bill is to block lwasuits from people who blame fast food companies for their obesity.  The second is a bill that would block gun manufacturers, dealers and importer from being sued by victims of gun violence.  This must be all congress has left to do since they already payed off the national debt, fixed the budget deficit, solved poverty in America and figured out how to get the troops of of Iraq. 
   Tom Delay was booked on charges of conspiracy and money laundering on Thursday. So much for being a member of the party that represents family values and high moral standards.  This is exactly why I find the Republican party to be so hypocritical, they travel around speaking of family values and moral character while at the same time doing the exact opposite.  A perfect example is Rush Limbaugh on his radio show he would talk about how America needs tougher sentences for drug users while at the same time he was dealing with his own drug habit.
"What's this guy's problem? Pretty obvious, isn't it? Bush is acting like a particularly conflicted teenager. Haughty, angry, mean, competitive, iconoclastic, arrogant, argumentative, mocking, paranoid, uncaring, thoughtless, profane-it's all there on the surface at one time or the other during a series of interviews and observations this spring."--Tucker Carlson

The trip to Washington D.C. was canceled because a certian person didn't turn in the paper work on time.  On the plus side I will actualy be home when Sage comes back.
Homecoming weekend was so much fun, I went to a party Saturday and found out that I own people at flip cup.
I think I am the only person not at all stressed out by mid terms.
I have been listening to an unhealthy amount of 80's new wave, all the synthesizers and keytars are killing what brain cells I have left.
Much like Ben Franklin I am always seeking self improvement and in order to better myself I am learning some Turkish and I believe I have already learned the most useful phrase in the Turkish language.  The phrase is "Bira istiyorum" it roughly translates into I would a beer.
"Boredom: the desire for desires."--Leo Tolstoy

I've been feeling tired the last couple of days and I think I'm sick, luckily I don't think it's anything glamorous like ebola or the plauge.  Tomorrow is the homecoming game against Ohio, I might have some people come over later on Saturday to watch Hockey Night in Canada.  The trip to Washington D.C. sounds like it might not happen.  It is also time to schedule for classes again and I have no idea what I should take.
"All hockey players are bilingual. They know English and profanity."--Gordie Howe

I'm thinking about heading home this weekend but I don't really feel like driving back.  I need to go home before the trip to Washington D.C. and this weekend or next weekend are the only available weekends I could make the trip.
I went and saw Waiting today and it is a pretty good movie.  I would recommend it to anybody that likes Eurotrip, Old School and those types of movies.
I'm thinking about studying abroad this summer and looking online I found a program in Turkey, that interests me.  If I have time this week I might stop into the OIE and get more information.

I drove back to Mt. Pleasant today and when I arrived I found that I had left my keys back in Ortonville.  Since I was locked out of the house I went to the library and finished my African Political Systems paper, then I went back to the house took a nap in my car and ate some ribs.  After class i went and saw the Corpse Bride with Brett and ate some Gumbo for dinner.  I think I'm going to make crab cakes at some point this week and try to find a theatre in Mt. P that is showing Capote.  Tomorrow is Tuesday which means it's Nip/Tuck and were going to have a bunch of people over, so if anybody is interested let me know.
"But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright Brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown."--Carl Sagan

At first I supported Cindy Sheehan in her protesting the war in Iraq and her campout in Crawford, Texas over the summer, but things have now changed.  After seeing her on Hardball today I realized she sounds remarkably  similar to a thirteen year old girl when she talks about her opinions on the war.  She could not find a clear reason why she doesn't support the war and seems to think that senators will change their mind on supporting the war after talking to her.  She also holds the belief that the only reason senators still support the war is that because they have some sort of self interest in it.  If she gave it a little more thought she might come to the conclusion that since we are stuck in Iraq for the next several years it would be to our benefit to completely fund the nation buidling so troops don't have to go back in ten years.
  On a lighter note I'm going to be heading home this weekend.  At the moment I'm not sure if I'm leaving Thursdaay after class or Friday after Michigan's Law Day, but I should be back in time for the football game friday night.  If anybody wants to do anything over the weekend give me a call, Saturday night will be particularly boring.
"There was never a good war, or a bad peace."--Benjamin Franklin

Yesterday was CMU and You day and I had to give two tours.  My first tour had around 40 people and the second  one had close to 80 people.  After my tours I went to the Central/Eastern game,  Central ended up losing 23-20 in overtime. For the rest of the day i didn't do anything of much importance, but arouund 2 this morning I was flipping through the channels on my TV.  I stopped on ESPN 2 to watch the Stump the Schwab, a sports trivia game show, and noticed one of the contestants looked very familiar.  As it turned out that contestant was Mr. Moore.  He did pretty good, he didn't win but he wasn't the first person eliminated.  It was a kind of surreal experience watching him on TV.
"You can't separate peace from freedom because no one can be at peace unless he has his freedom." -Malcolm X

After a week of procrastination and two days of actual work I finally finished my paper on Changes and Continuity in Child-Rearing Advice.  I have a fairly busy weekend planned on Friday I have to give my normal tour at 12 and I'm covering for Danelle and doing her tour at 2.  I also need to go to the SOC at some point on Friday and do my ofice hour for Phi Alpha Delta.  Saturday is CMU and you day so I have to work from 8-12 irecting people around and giving more tours after which I plan on going to the Football game at 1.  Then on Sunday my friend Tashanna organized a Hurricane benefit at 6, so I'm going to go check that out.
"Anyone who knows anything of history knows that great social changes are impossible without feminine upheaval. Social progress can be measured exactly by the social position of the fair sex, the ugly ones included."- Karl Marx

I have to give Joe Neal credit for this one. Go to google type in the word "failure" and click the "I'm felling Lucky button and see what comes up.
"Avoid all needle drugs, the only dope worth shooting is Richard Nixon."- Abbie Hoffman

I went to Cedar Point over the weekend for my fundraising requirement for Phi Alpha Delta.  We left Friday around 12 and got to Cedar Point around 5:30, after getting halfway to Cleveland before we figured out we missed the exit.  After a short orientation we had the rest of the night to enjoy the park.  After leaving the park at 11 we went to TGI Fridays until they closed at midnight.  Not wanting to sleep we all went over to Louie's Bar until around 1:30.  Louie's reminds me of somebody's basement with a walk out patio, it was a great bar with cheap beer.  They also didn't seem to care about how was drinking just as long as you didn't cause any trouble.  We had to start working as carnies the next day at 10, I was assigned to some store in the back of the park the sells over-priced crap that people still insist on buying.  The guy I got to work with, Tomasz, was a student from Poland working here for the summer.  Tomasz did not have the "Protestant Work Ethic and the Spirit of Capitalism" as described by Max Weber. Instead his advice to me as very American, "It doesn't matter how hard you work here because the work is very easy."  So rather than working hard we spent most of the day talking about soccer and why the Poolish are just Germany's version of rednecks.  We left the park around 9 and I went to Fridays with Amber and her friend Ashley to get some food before heading back to Louie's, this time we stayed there until closing at 2.  We then made the short walk back to the small dorms we were housed in for the weekend and we tried ordering pizza at 3:30 in the morning but to our surprise nothing was open, I finally went to bed around 4.  The next day I worked alone at a cart and made around $40 in sales and half of that was from a t-shirt. I got out of work around 6:30 and rode the train for an hour with Chris and Andrew until Uncle Geno was done working.  Before we left Ohio we had to stop and buy fireworks.  We got back to Mt. Pleasant around 1:30 and when we dropped off Chris and Andrew at Fox Run apartments Andrew decided it would be a good idea to light off one of his thunder stick firecrackers.  It was a pretty fun weekend and a chance to hang out with some friends.

"Dictatorship naturally arises out of democracy, and the most aggravated form of tyranny and slavery out of the most extreme liberty."- Plato

These numbers are courtesy of CM Life and cover the goings on during welcome weekend.
30- MIPs
1- Nuisance Party
3- Fugitive Warrant Arrests
15- OWIs/Arrests
17- Open Intoxicants
7- Driving with Suspended Licenses
...and a whole lot of fun.

"I would like to apologize for referring to George W. Bush as a 'deserter.' What I meant to say is that George W. Bush is a deserter, an election thief, a drunk driver, a WMD liar, and a functional illiterate. And he poops his pants."-Michael Moore

Welcome weekend was a blast we had a drunk freshmen throwing bricks, lots of police and general craziness.  It turns out that the street I'm living on is main street junior, since I moved up here it has been non stop partying on this street.  The Bowling for Soup Concert at mainstage was great, those guys put on a hell of a show. They really got the crowd into the show and the are pretty  funny. The opening band, Changes, was pretty sweet too.  Also found out that my RA from last year got fired, but nobody I've talked to knows what for.  The weekend was fun but now I have to learn.

"I'm the type who'd be happy not going anywhere as long as I was sure I knew exactly what was happening at the places I wasn't going to. I'm the type who'd like to sit home and watch every party that I'm invited to on a monitor in my bedroom."- Andy Warhol

Bowling for Soup is play this year at MAINstage up at school, that should be a good show.

If I didn't have to work the next day I would be going to OZZfest, but I only have three more weeks left.

Who do you think is the better lawyer Ben Matlock or Perry Mason?


"And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth."

Because I am tired tonight and don't feel like writting a post; here is the lyrics to one of my favorite punk songs.  
       
Dead Kennedys "Moral Majority"

You call yourself the Moral Majority
We call ourselves the people in the real world
Trying to rub us out, but we're going to survive
God must be dead if you're alive

You say, 'God loves you. Come and buy the Good News'
Then you buy the president and swimming pools
If Jesus don't save 'til we're lining your pockets
God must be dead if you're alive

"The White House is completely disconnected from reality.  It's like they're just making it up as they go along. The reality is that we're losing in Iraq." 
You might be thinking those remarks came from somebody like Howard Dean, Ted Kennedy or Nancy Pelosi.  Those remarks really came from Chuck Hagel a senator from Nebraska, I should also mention that he is a republican.  Republicans are now begining to lose faith in the President, who has been ineffective in getting his domestic adgenda to pass in spite of having control of both houses.  The question now has to be asked, are the Republicans are delusional or just misleading the American people about the state of things in Iraq?
"People never lie so much as after a hunt, during a war or before an election."-- Otto von Bismarck

Kwame Kilpatrick is now threating to cancel the fireworks in detroit if the city council doesn't pass his budget.  Kwame is a joke of a mayor and Sharon McPhail will destroy him in the next election.
  Finally Detroit beat Miami, now I can stop hearing about how Shaq is the greatest big man to play the game.  At best he his the ninth best big man behind Wilt Chamberlain, Bill Russell, Karemm Abdul-Jabbar, Hakeem Olajuwon, David Robinson, Patrick Ewing, Moses Malone and George Mikan.
  Next Summer the World Cup will be in Germany and I think Brazil will beat Germany to win the World Cup.  Brazil has alot of scoring with Ronaldo, Kaka, Ronaldinho, and Rivaldo.  Germany has great defense but their goalkeeper, Oliver Kahn, will be 37 by the time the World Cup starts.  Their scoring mostly relies on two players Michael Ballack and Miroslav Klose.
  "You can't be a real country unless you have a beer and an airline. It helps if you have some kind of a football team, or some nuclear weapons, but at the very least you need a beer." - Frank Zappa

It's been awhile since I last updated, summer has been kind of boring because Ortonville is boring.  I work three days a week at a sunroof factory in Grand Blanc, we work 12 hour shifts and I make $11.75 an hour so by the time summer is over I should have quite a bit saved up.

I think I have found heaven and its name is the Beer Barell Belly Buster.  It is 10.5 pounds of beef, 25 slices of cheese, a head of letuce, 3 tomatoes, 2 onions, a cup and half each of mayo, relish, ketchup, mustard, banana peppers and of course a bun.

I went to reggae fest today and it was probably the most fun I've had since school started.  Reggae fest is an all day music festival and you are free to do whatever you want while you are there.  I am so tired nd slightly sunburned but it was all worth it.  Tomorrow I have to finnish my foreign policy paper and study for exams and I might head out for Ashley's 21st birthday.  My last exam is wednesday and I'll be out of here, everyone her wants to leave but at the same time nobody wants to leave.
"These are times that try men's souls. The summer soldier and the sunshine patriot will, in this crisis, shrink from the service of their country; but he that stands now, deserves the love and thanks of man and woman."-- Thomas Paine

I just finished a 2 1/2 hour meeting for Phi Alpha Delta, we did all the e-board elections and committee chair persons.  It was super long but on the plus side I am now the chair person for the finance committee.  Today was also the last day of classes, but exams start next week.  My exam schedule is pretty easy, I have two exams on monday, two on tuesday and one on thursday.  I just wish my thursday exam was on tuesday so I could get out of here.
"Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability."-- Sam Keen

China is going to have its first Oktoberfest, it will take place in the province of Guangzhou.  For those of you that are not of German heritage Oktoberfest is meant to celebrate the harvest, but with any German celebration it involves beer and sausage.  After hearing stories of the 'fatherland' from my grandparents I think Oktoberfest can best be described as Labor day and Fourth of July rolled into one. 
Tomorrow is also my last day of classes and Saturday is Rock and Reggae Fest.
"Where faith is in the plighted hand, where truth lives in each eye of blue, and every heart is staunch and true. This is the land, the honest land, the honest German's fatherland."- Ernst Moritz Arndt

"Hurricane"

Pistols shots ring out in the barroom night
Enter Patty Valentine from the upper hall
She sees the bartender in a pool of blood
Cries out "My God they killed them all"
Here comes the story of the Hurricane
The man the authorities came to blame
For something that he never done
Put him in a prison cell but one time he could-a been
The champion of the world.

Three bodies lying there does Patty see
And another man named Bello moving around mysteriously
"I didn't do it" he says and he throws up his hands
"I was only robbing the register I hope you understand
I saw them leaving" he says and he stops
"One of us had better call up the cops"
And so Patty calls the cops
And they arrive on the scene with their red lights flashing
In the hot New Jersey night.

Meanwhile far away in another part of town
Rubin Carter and a couple of friends are driving around
Number one contender for the middleweight crown
Had no idea what kinda shit was about to go down
When a cop pulled him over to the side of the road
Just like the time before and the time before that
In Patterson that's just the way things go
If you're black you might as well not shown up on the street
'Less you wanna draw the heat.

Alfred Bello had a partner and he had a rap for the corps
Him and Arthur Dexter Bradley were just out prowling around
He said "I saw two men running out they looked like middleweights
They jumped into a white car with out-of-state plates"
And Miss Patty Valentine just nodded her head
Cop said "Wait a minute boys this one's not dead"
So they took him to the infirmary
And though this man could hardly see
They told him that he could identify the guilty men.

Four in the morning and they haul Rubin in
Take him to the hospital and they bring him upstairs
The wounded man looks up through his one dying eye
Says "Wha'd you bring him in here for ? He ain't the guy !"
Yes here comes the story of the Hurricane
The man the authorities came to blame
For something that he never done
Put in a prison cell but one time he could-a been
The champion of the world.

Four months later the ghettos are in flame
Rubin's in South America fighting for his name
While Arthur Dexter Bradley's still in the robbery game
And the cops are putting the screws to him looking for somebody to blame
"Remember that murder that happened in a bar ?"
"Remember you said you saw the getaway car?"
"You think you'd like to play ball with the law ?"
"Think it might-a been that fighter you saw running that night ?"
"Don't forget that you are white".

Arthur Dexter Bradley said "I'm really not sure"
Cops said "A boy like you could use a break
We got you for the motel job and we're talking to your friend Bello
Now you don't wanta have to go back to jail be a nice fellow
You'll be doing society a favor
That sonofabitch is brave and getting braver
We want to put his ass in stir
We want to pin this triple murder on him
He ain't no Gentleman Jim".

Rubin could take a man out with just one punch
But he never did like to talk about it all that much
It's my work he'd say and I do it for pay
And when it's over I'd just as soon go on my way
Up to some paradise
Where the trout streams flow and the air is nice
And ride a horse along a trail
But then they took him to the jailhouse
Where they try to turn a man into a mouse.

All of Rubin's cards were marked in advance
The trial was a pig-circus he never had a chance
The judge made Rubin's witnesses drunkards from the slums
To the white folks who watched he was a revolutionary bum
And to the black folks he was just a crazy nigger
No one doubted that he pulled the trigger
And though they could not produce the gun
The DA said he was the one who did the deed
And the all-white jury agreed.

Rubin Carter was falsely tried
The crime was murder 'one' guess who testified
Bello and Bradley and they both baldly lied
And the newspapers they all went along for the ride
How can the life of such a man
Be in the palm of some fool's hand ?
To see him obviously framed
Couldn't help but make me feel ashamed to live in a land
Where justice is a game.

Now all the criminals in their coats and their ties
Are free to drink martinis and watch the sun rise
While Rubin sits like Buddha in a ten-foot cell
An innocent man in a living hell
That's the story of the Hurricane
But it won't be over till they clear his name
And give him back the time he's done
Put him in a prison cell but one time he could-a been
The champion of the world.

The republican controlled house today approved a bill that would allow drilling in ANWR (Artic National Wildlife Refuge).  The bill gives $8.1 billion in tax breaks to coal, nuclear, oil, and natural gas companies; this really isn't a surprise if you now anything about the republican party.  Why not give that $8.1 billion to comparies that are working on developing alternate fuel sources, if oil usage rates continue we have between 40-75 years worth of oil left to drill.  An amendment that would require automakers to have an average miles per gallon of 33 was defeated.  33 miles per gallon is not a ridiculos number, but why would  a republican house member want to put pressure on the companies that financed his/her campaign.
The state house in Texas passed a bill banning gay foster parents because apparently they would rather have a child stuck in a horrible child care system (several children were killed in the past year by foster parents) than have them go to a loving family in which the parents happen to be gay.   "It is our responsibility to make sure that we protect our most vulnerable children and I don't think we are doing that if we allow a foster parent that is homosexual or bisexual," Rep. Robert Talton.  Guess which party this man belongs to.  That's right he is the typical republican bigot.  If you don't believe in gay marriage or you believe that gay people are going to burn in hell, that is your own personal choice.  Don't impose that belief on other people especially when children hwo need a loving home are involved.
"I actually feel sorry for people who have a lot of illusions in their head about what gay is. I mean, I know some gay people who are really wonderful people." -Richard Chamberlain

Sage is coming home May 6.  This cold weather sucks and if it snows over the weekend I will leave the state forever. "You better cut the pizza in four pieces because I'm not hungry enough to eat six."-Yogi Berra
